intro: Astragalus zaraensis, commonly known as Zara's milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It plays a role in soil stabilization and is of interest in ecological restoration projects. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some areas.
